data.title: 126 Films of the united states 1918 Images: PICRYL
data.meta_description: Download Images of  - Free for commercial use, no attribution required. From: Hollywood movie stills - NARA - 285380, to A Mother's Secret 01. Find  images dated from 1915 to 1970.
data.meta_site_name: PICRYL - Public Domain Media Search Engine
data.text:
A scene from "Viviette" (SAYRE 12980)

A scene from "Viviette," which played at the Liberty Theater, Seattle. Date stamped May 30, 1918. Includes Vivian Martin, who was originally from Bellevue, WA. Subjects: motion pictures, actresses Vivian Ma ... More

A scene from "Bonnie Annie Laurie" (SAYRE 13187)

A scene from the American drama film Bonnie Annie Laurie (1918), which played at the Colonial Theater, Seattle. Includes Peggy Hyland and Henry Hallam. Date stamped Mar. 4, 1918. Subjects: motion pictures, actresses

A scene from "Burglar for Tonight" (SAYRE 13523)

A scene from the American comedy drama film A Burglar for a Night (1918) which played at the Little Theater, Seattle. Date stamped Nov. 24, 1918. Includes J. Warren Kerrigan. [Title per the IMDb.] Subjects: mo ... More

A scene from "Her Country First" (SAYRE 13542)

A scene from Her Country First (1918) which played at the Coliseum Theater, Seattle. Includes Vivian Martin. Date stamped Sept. 26, 1919. Subjects: motion pictures, actresses Vivian Martin was an American act ... More

A scene from "Keith of the Border" (SAYRE 13520)

A scene from Keith of the Border which played at the Mission Theater, Seattle. Includes Norbert Cills and Roy Stewart. Date stamped Mar. 10, 1918. Subjects: motion pictures, actors

A scene from "The Song of Songs" (SAYRE 13220)

A scene from the American drama film The Song of Songs (1918), which played at the Strand Theater, Seattle. Date stamped Ap. 7, 1918. Includes Elsie Ferguson (center). Subjects: motion pictures, actresses

Her Mistake (1918) - Ad 1 - Public domain book illustration

Ad for the American film Her Mistake (1918) with Evelyn Nesbit and her son Russell William Thaw, on page 151 of the January 11,1919 Moving Picture World.

Alias Mary Brown (1918) - 1 - Public domain portrait print

Advertisement for the American crime drama film Alias Mary Brown (1918) with Pauline Starke, on page 35 of the July 26, 1918 Variety.

Among the Cannibal Isles of the South Pacific (1918) - 1

Advertisement for the American documentary film Among the Cannibal Isles of the South Pacific (1918), on page 35 of the July 26, 1918 Variety.

Ashes of Love (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Newspaper ad for the American film Ashes of Love (1918) with Mabel Julienne Scott, on page 6 of the November 11, 1922 Duluth Herald.

Blue Blazes Rawden (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American western film 'Blue Blazes' Rawden (1918) with William S. Hart, on page 46 of the March 15, 1918 Variety.

Bound in Morocco1918newspaperad

Bound in Morocco (1918) is a silent film comedy/drama starring Douglas Fairbanks. This is from an advertisement for the film.

The Claw (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American drama film The Claw (1918) with Clara Kimball Young, on page 30 of the June 14, 1918 Variety.

Cupid angling ad-1918. Silent film movie advertisement

Cupid Angling (1918) is a silent film, the fifth feature film photographed in color. This is an advertisement for the film.

Daybreak-1918-newspaperad. Silent film movie advertisement

Daybreak is a 1918 American silent drama film directed by Albert Capellani. This is a newspaper advert for this film and others.

Keys of the Righteous (1918) - 1

Advertisement for the American drama film Keys of the Righteous (1918) aka The Keys of the Righteous with Enid Bennett, on page 41 of the January 25, 1918 Variety.

Leap to Fame (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American drama film Leap to Fame (1918) with Carlyle Blackwell and Evelyn Greeley, on page 42 of the May 10, 1918 Variety.

The Movie Dummy (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American comedy short film The Movie Dummy (1918) with Armando Novello aka Toto, on page 239 of the December 28, 1917 Variety.

The Spreading Evil (1918) - 1 during World War I

Teaser advertisement for the American drama film The Spreading Evil (1918), on page 47 of the November 22, 1918 Variety. The film warned of American servicemen contacting syphilis from European woman during Wo ... More

Station Content 1918 - Public domain dedication image

Lobby card with Gloria Swanson and Lee Hill in the 1918 American film Station Content. Approximately 28 x 35.5 cm. Part of the Western silent films lobby card collection, 1912-1930. Cite as from the Yale Colle ... More

The Studio Girl (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American comedy romance film The Studio Girl (1918) with Constance Talmadge, on page 48 of the February 22, 1918 Variety.

Vengeance (1918) - 1 - Public domain portrait print

Advertisement for the American drama film Vengeance (1918) with Montagu Love and Barbara Castleton, on page 30 of the May 31, 1918 Variety.

Wild Youth (1918) - 1. Silent film movie advertisement

Advertisement for the American drama film Wild Youth (1918) with Jack Mulhall and Louise Huff, on page 44 of the March 8, 1918 Variety.

The Finger of Justice (1918) - 1

Advertisement for the American crime short film The Finger of Justice (1918), on page 15 of the June 29, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Beauty and the Rogue (1918) - 1

Advertisement for the American comedy crime drama film Beauty and the Rogue (1918) with Mary Miles Minter, on page 3 of the February 2, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Powers That Prey (1918) - 1 - silent film printed advertisement

Still from the American comedy drama film Powers That Prey (1918) with Mary Miles Minter and Allan Forrest, on page 24 of the March 9, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Wives and Other Wives (1918) - 1

Advertisement for the American comedy drama film Wives and Other Wives (1918) with Mary Miles Minter, on page 11 of the December 21, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Miriamcooper. Silent film movie advertisement

A still from the Miriam Cooper film The Woman and the Law by Raoul Walsh (1918). Taken before 1923, as she quit acting in 1924.

The Bells (1918) - Ad 1 - Vintage movie public domain poster

Ad for the American film The Bells (1918) with Frank Keenan, page 898 of the November 30, 1918 Moving Picture World.

The Challenge Accepted (1918) - Ad 1

Still from the American film Dolly's Vacation (1918) with Baby Marie Osborne and Ernie Morrison, on page 189 of the January 11, 1919 Moving Picture World.

Follow the Crowd 1918 movieposter

Follow the Crowd is a 1918 short comedy film with Harold Lloyd. This is a poster of that film.

Doing Their Bit (1918) lantern slide

This is a lantern slide for the 1918 American silent comedy-drama film Doing Their Bit.

I love You during World War I - silent film printed advertisement

"A Ringer for Business": Advertisement for the film I Love You, starring Alma Rubens, in Moving Picture World, January 1918

The Bravest Way is a 1918 American silent drama film directed by George Melford and written by Edith M. Kennedy.

Still from the American drama film The Cruise of the Make-Believes (1918) with Lila Lee and Spottiswoode Aitken, on page 35 of the September 21, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

The Goat (1918) - 1 - Vintage movie public domain poster

Mrfixit-newspaperadvert-1918 - Vintage movie public domain poster

Mr. Fix-It (1918) is a silent film comedy starring Douglas Fairbanks, Marjorie Daw, and Wanda Hawley, directed by Allan Dwan at Artcraft Pictures, and released by Paramount Pictures. This is a newspaper advert ... More

A Nine O'Clock Town (1918) - 1 - Vintage movie public domain poster

Still from the American comedy film A Nine O'Clock Town (1918) with Caroline Rankin, Charles Ray, and Jane Novak, on page 29 of the August 17, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Onthequiet-1919-newspaperad - Vintage movie public domain poster

On the Quiet is a lost 1918 silent film comedy produced by Famous Players-Lasky and released by Paramount Pictures. This is from publicity for the film as published in a contemporary newspaper.

Quicksand (1918) - 1 - Vintage movie public domain poster

Still from the American drama film Quicksand (1918) with Henry A. Barrows and Dorothy Dalton, on page 33 of the December 21, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Hide and Seek, Detectives (1918) still 1

L. to R. : Tom Kennedy, Marie Prevost, Heinie Conklin (aka Charles Lynn) & Ben Turpin in the short comedy Hide and Seek, Detectives - publicity still

Some Job & The Agonies of Agnes (1918) - 1

Half page advertisement for two World Film comedy short films, Some Job (1918) with Fay Tincher and The Agonies of Agnes (1918) with Marie Dressler, on page 3 of the July 6, 1918 Exhibitors Herald.

Scope and content: Confrontation over woman in bedroom; ranch hands eating; cowboys chasing train.

Lure of the Circus poster - Vintage movie public domain poster

Poster for the 1918 film Lure of the Circus. The film is presented in serial form and this poster is for the seventh episode, "The Charge of the Elephant".
